item.title: Publications
item.description: Journal Articles Senninger, Roman (2023) What Makes Policy Complex?, Political Science Research and Methods Senninger, Roman and Daniel Bischof (2023) Do Voters Want Domestic Politicians to Scrutinize the European Union?, Political Science Research and Methods, Vol 11, Issue 2, 410-418. Senninger, Roman, Daniel Bischof and Lawrence Ezrow (2022) How Transnational Party Alliances Influence National Parties’ Policies, Political Science Research and Methods, Vol 10, Issue 3, 651-658. Senninger, Roman and Jens Blom-Hansen (2021) Meet the Critics: Analyzing the EU Commission’s Regulatory Scrutiny Board through Quantitative Text Analysis, Regulation & Governance, Vol 15, Issue 4, 1436-1453.

item.title: Roman Senninger
item.description: I am an Associate Professor of Political Science at Aarhus University. My research focuses on political elites and political institutions in Europe. Methodologically, I have a strong interest in (quasi-) experiments, computational text analysis, and spatial and geographic data analysis. I hold a Semper Ardens Accelerate Grant from the Carlsberg Foundation for the project ‘How and Why Politicians Learn From Policies from Abroad’.
